questions.question: 1. Which law governs the rate of settling of particles in a fluid during sedimentation?
2. What is the function of the Andresen pipette in the sedimentation method?

answers.a: To agitate the suspension for better mixing.
answers.b: To measure the height of the suspension.
answers.c: To collect sediment at specified time intervals.
answers.d: To measure the viscosity of the liquid.

questions.question: 3. What is Stokes' Law used for in the sedimentation method?

answers.a: To calculate the concentration of the suspension.
answers.b: To determine the settling velocity of particles based on their size.
answers.c: To collect sediment at specified time intervals.
answers.d: To estimate the total volume of the suspension.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following liquids is commonly used as a medium in sedimentation methods?
5. Why is it important to ensure that the suspension is well-mixed before starting the sedimentation experiment?

answers.a: To increase the density of the suspension.
answers.b: To prevent particles from clumping together and forming aggregates.ter
answers.c: To reduce the viscosity of the liquid.ry
answers.d: To improve the sensitivity of the pipette.
